intro: Coccoloba costata, commonly known as the coastal beauty or sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean and the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed margins, which are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to salt spray and wind exposure. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for coastal gardens and landscapes.
